page.title: 13Tourism in Much Wenlock.
page.content: Many tourists, from all over the world, come to Much Wenlock and the surrounding area. The{centre of {Much Wenlock}is a{conservation area, containing many old, black and white buildings and narrow streets. Two important buildings visited by many people are{The Guildhall}and{The {Corn Exchange. The countryside surrounding Much Wenlock is very beautiful and attracts many people. Much Wenlock is also the birthplace of {Dr.William Penny Brookes}whose plans and ideas were used by{Pierre de {Coubertin}in the founding of the modern{Olympic Games.}He was a very influential man in Much Wenlock, raising money for The Guildhall and The Corn Exchange, setting up an agricultural library and founding the {Wenlock Olympian Society.
